disclosure_title: Policies to halt and reverse biodiversity loss
description: Disclosure 101-1 requires organizations to describe their policies or commitments to halt and reverse biodiversity loss, informed by the 2050 Goals and 2030 Targets in the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework.
requirements: 1. Describe policies or commitments to halt and reverse biodiversity loss, informed by the Global Biodiversity Framework. 2. Report the extent of application of these policies to the organization's activities and business relationships. 3. Report goals and targets related to biodiversity loss, including base year and indicators for progress evaluation.

disclosure_title: Management of biodiversity impacts
description: Disclosure GRI 101-2 requires organizations to report on how they manage their biodiversity impacts, particularly if biodiversity is identified as a material topic. This includes detailing policies, commitments, and actions taken to halt and reverse biodiversity loss, as well as relevant disclosures related to biodiversity impacts.
requirements: Organizations must describe their policies or commitments to halt and reverse biodiversity loss, how these are informed by the Global Biodiversity Framework, the extent of application to their activities and business relationships, and the goals and targets set to evaluate progress. They must also report any relevant disclosures from the section (101-1 through 101-3) that pertain to biodiversity-related impacts.

disclosure_title: Access and benefit-sharing 2. Topic disclosures
description: Disclosure GRI 101-3 requires organizations to report on their access and benefit-sharing practices related to biodiversity, specifically how they manage biodiversity-related impacts and the relevant disclosures from the GRI Standards.
requirements: Organizations must report on their policies to halt and reverse biodiversity loss, the extent of these policies' application, and the goals and targets set to address biodiversity loss. They must also identify significant biodiversity impacts from their sites and supply chain, explaining the methods used to determine these impacts.

disclosure_title: Identification of biodiversity impacts
description: Disclosure 101-4 requires organizations to explain how they determine which of their sites and supply chain products and services have the most significant actual and potential impacts on biodiversity.
requirements: Organizations must describe the methods and assumptions used to identify significant biodiversity impacts, set thresholds for determining significance, report any limitations or exclusions, and provide sources and evidence for their findings. They should also explain stakeholder engagement in identifying biodiversity impacts.

disclosure_title: Locations with biodiversity impacts
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on locations and activities that have significant impacts on biodiversity, including the size of sites, their proximity to ecologically sensitive areas, and the products and services in their supply chain that affect biodiversity.
requirements: 1. Report the location and size in hectares of sites with significant biodiversity impacts. 2. For each site, indicate if it is in or near ecologically sensitive areas and provide details on the type of area. 3. Report activities taking place at each site. 4. Identify products and services in the supply chain with significant biodiversity impacts and their associated locations.

disclosure_title: Direct drivers of biodiversity loss
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the direct drivers of biodiversity loss associated with their activities, including land and sea use change, exploitation of natural resources, pollution, and introduction of invasive alien species.

natural_ecosystem_conversion.size_in_hectares: Size in hectares of natural ecosystem converted since a cut-off or reference date
natural_ecosystem_conversion.ecosystem_types: Type of ecosystem before and after conversion

intensively_used_ecosystem_conversion.size_in_hectares: Size in hectares of land and sea converted from one intensively used or modified ecosystem to another
intensively_used_ecosystem_conversion.ecosystem_types: Type of ecosystem before and after conversion

wild_species_harvested.quantity: Quantity of each wild species harvested
wild_species_harvested.type: Type of each wild species harvested
wild_species_harvested.extinction_risk: Extinction risk of each wild species harvested

invasive_alien_species.description: Description of how invasive alien species are or may be introduced

supply_chain.reporting: Report the information required under the above categories with a breakdown by country or jurisdiction

requirements.contextual_information: Report contextual information necessary to understand how the data has been compiled, including standards, methodologies, and assumptions used.

disclosure_title: Changes to the state of biodiversity
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on changes to the state of biodiversity for affected or potentially affected ecosystems, including ecosystem type, size, and condition for both the base year and the current reporting period.
requirements: For each site reported under 101-5-a, report the ecosystem type, size in hectares, and condition for the base year and current reporting period. Provide contextual information on data compilation, including standards, methodologies, and assumptions. Report changes for each product and service under 101-5-d by country or jurisdiction, and for the downstream value chain. Consider all ecosystem types that could be affected by the organization's activities.

disclosure_title: Ecosystem services
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on ecosystem services, including the status of species listed in CITES, the ecological sensitivity of harvesting areas, and the extinction risk of species using the IUCN Red List.
requirements: Organizations must report if species are listed in CITES, if they are harvested from ecologically sensitive areas, and provide information on the extinction risk of species using the IUCN Red List. They should also report on invasive alien species and their potential impacts on local biodiversity.

disclosure_title: Transition plan for climate change mitigation
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe their transition plan for climate change mitigation, including policies, actions, alignment with scientific evidence, governance, integration into business strategy, targets, stakeholder engagement, impacts on people and the environment, public policy consistency, and reasons for the absence of a transition plan if applicable.

requirements.a: Describe the transition plan, including policies and actions to mitigate climate change.
requirements.b: Align the transition plan with scientific evidence to limit global warming to 1.5°C, including sources and methodologies.
requirements.c: Report total expenditure incurred for the transition plan as a monetary value and percentage of total expenditure.
requirements.d: Report governance bodies or individual roles responsible for overseeing and implementing the transition plan.
requirements.e: Describe how the transition plan is embedded in the business strategy.
requirements.f: Report targets for the transition plan, including GHG emissions reduction targets, fossil fuel phase-out targets, and other climate change mitigation targets.
requirements.g: Describe alignment with just transition principles and stakeholder engagement.
requirements.h: Describe impacts on people and the environment from the transition plan and actions taken to manage them.
requirements.i: Explain public policy activities consistent with the transition plan.
requirements.j: If no transition plan exists, explain why and describe steps to develop it and the expected timeframe.

disclosure_title: Climate change adaptation plan 2. Topic disclosures
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their transition plan for climate change mitigation, detailing policies, actions, governance, targets, and impacts related to climate change adaptation and mitigation efforts.
requirements: 1. Describe the transition plan, including policies and actions to mitigate climate change. 2. Align the plan with scientific evidence for limiting global warming to 1.5°C. 3. Report total expenditure on the transition plan. 4. Identify governance bodies responsible for the plan. 5. Embed the plan in business strategy. 6. Report targets for GHG emissions reduction and progress. 7. Align the plan with just transition principles. 8. Describe impacts on people and the environment. 9. Ensure public policy activities are consistent with the plan. 10. Explain absence of a transition plan if applicable.

disclosure_title: Just transition
description: Disclosure 102-3 requires organizations to report on the impacts of their transition or adaptation efforts related to climate change on workers, local communities, and Indigenous Peoples, ensuring a just transition.

new_employees_recruited.total: Total number of new employees recruited

terminated_employees.total: Total number of employees whose work was terminated

trained_employees.total: Total number of employees who received training for up- and re-skilling

new_non_employee_workers.total: Total number of new workers who are not employees recruited

terminated_non_employee_workers.total: Total number of workers who are not employees whose work was terminated

pay_comparison.total: Total number and percentage of new employees recruited whose basic pay is at or above the cost-of-living estimate
pay_comparison.actions: Describe actions taken or commitments made to address any gaps between basic pay and the cost-of-living estimate

locations_of_operation.list: List the locations of operation where the organization has impacts on local communities and Indigenous Peoples

community_agreements.percentage: Report the percentage of locations of operation where an agreement has been reached with affected or potentially affected local communities or Indigenous Peoples

contextual_information.methodologies: Report contextual information necessary to understand the data reported and describe the methodologies and assumptions used to compile the data

disclosure_title: GHG emissions reduction targets and progress
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report their short-, medium-, and long-term greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions reduction targets, including progress made towards these targets, in metric tons of CO₂ equivalent and as a percentage of base year emissions.
requirements: Organizations must report gross Scope 1, Scope 2, and Scope 3 GHG emissions reduction targets separately or combined, excluding GHG removals, trades, and avoided emissions. They must specify whether biogenic CO₂ emissions are included, the method used for Scope 2 targets, the Scope 3 categories covered, and the gases included. Additionally, organizations must explain how targets align with scientific evidence for limiting global warming to 1.5°C, describe their target revision policy, report base year details, and progress towards targets using specified formulas. They should also disclose standards, methodologies, assumptions, and calculation tools used.

disclosure_title: GHG emissions intensity
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report their GHG emissions intensity ratios, which are calculated by dividing gross GHG emissions in metric tons of CO₂ equivalent by an organization-specific metric. It also specifies the scopes of GHG emissions included in the ratios.
requirements: Organizations must report GHG emissions intensity ratios including gross GHG emissions (numerator) and an organization-specific metric (denominator). They should specify the scopes of GHG emissions (Scope 1, Scope 2, or Scope 3) included in the ratios. The organization should select a consistent organizational boundary for both numerator and denominator and may provide breakdowns of the ratios by relevant categories.

disclosure_title: GHG removals in the value chain
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their Scope 1 GHG removals in metric tons of CO₂ equivalent, detailing the breakdown by storage pools and addressing various quality and impact criteria.
requirements: 1. Report total Scope 1 GHG removals in metric tons of CO₂ equivalent, excluding GHG trades, with a breakdown by each storage pool. 2. For each storage pool, describe how quality criteria are monitored to manage non-permanence risks. 3. Report the intended use of GHG removals. 4. Describe impacts on people and the environment from Scope 1 GHG removals, including effects on workers, local communities, Indigenous Peoples, and biodiversity. 5. Report standards, methodologies, assumptions, and calculation tools used. 6. Report total Scope 3 GHG removals in metric tons of CO₂ equivalent, excluding GHG trades, with a breakdown by storage pool.

disclosure_title: Carbon credits
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on carbon credits, including the total amount canceled, details of the projects associated with those credits, adherence to quality criteria, the purpose of cancellation, and the impacts on people and the environment.
requirements: 1. Report total carbon credits canceled in metric tons of CO₂ equivalent and breakdown by removal or reduction projects. 2. For each canceled project, provide project name and ID, project type, cancellation serial number, cancellation date, vintage, host country, and issuing registry. 3. Describe adherence to quality criteria: additionality, credible baselines, permanence, leakage avoidance, unique issuance and claiming, regular monitoring, independent validation and verification, GHG program governance. 4. Report the purpose of carbon credit cancellation. 5. Describe impacts on people and the environment, including stakeholder consultation, human rights respect, socio-economic benefits, biodiversity conservation, and trade-off assessments.

disclosure_title: Energy policies and commitments 2. Topic disclosures
description: Disclosure 103-1 requires organizations to describe how their energy-related policies and commitments contribute to energy consumption reduction, energy efficiency, and the transition to renewable energy sources, as well as the impacts of their energy consumption and transition on the economy, environment, and people.
requirements: Organizations must describe their energy-related policies and commitments, how these relate to applicable regulations, alignment with scientific evidence on limiting global warming to 1.5°C, and their short-, medium-, and long-term targets. They should also explain stakeholder engagement processes that inform these policies and commitments.

disclosure_title: Energy consumption and self-generation within the organization
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their total energy consumption and self-generation, including a breakdown by renewable and non-renewable sources, as well as details on purchased and self-generated electricity, heating, cooling, and steam.
requirements: 1. Report total fuel consumption in joules, watt-hours, or multiples, broken down by renewable and non-renewable sources and by activity. 2. Report total purchased electricity, heating, cooling, and steam consumption in joules, watt-hours, or multiples, broken down by renewable and non-renewable sources. 3. Report total self-generated renewable electricity, heating, cooling, and steam consumption in joules, watt-hours, or multiples, broken down by activity. 4. Report total self-generated electricity, heating, cooling, and steam sold in joules, watt-hours, or multiples, broken down by renewable and non-renewable sources. 5. Indicate if contractual instruments are used for purchased electricity and describe their adherence to quality criteria. 6. Report standards, methodologies, assumptions, and calculation tools used, including sources of conversion factors.

disclosure_title: Upstream and downstream energy consumption
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report total significant energy consumption in their upstream and downstream value chain, including the categories where this consumption occurs, and to provide details on the methodologies and tools used for calculations.
requirements: Report total significant energy consumption in joules or watt-hours, list upstream and downstream categories of significant energy consumption, and provide standards, methodologies, assumptions, and calculation tools used, including sources of conversion factors.

disclosure_title: Energy intensity
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report their energy intensity ratios, detailing the energy consumption in relation to an organization-specific metric, and to specify the scope and types of energy consumption included in the ratios.
requirements: Organizations must report energy intensity ratio(s) including energy consumption in joules, watt-hours, or multiples (numerator) and an organization-specific metric (denominator). They must indicate whether the ratios include energy consumption within the organization, in its upstream and downstream value chain, or both, and specify the types of energy consumption included (fuel, electricity, heating, cooling, or steam).

disclosure_title: Reduction in energy consumption
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the reduction in energy consumption achieved, detailing the sources of reduction, types of energy consumed, and the methods used for measurement.
requirements: Organizations must report the reduction in energy consumption in joules or watt-hours, including reductions from conservation initiatives and other factors. They must specify the types of energy consumed (fuel, electricity, heating, cooling, steam), the scope of the reduction (within the organization or value chain), the methods of estimation or measurement, the base year for comparison, and the standards and methodologies used.

disclosure_title: Direct economic value generated and distributed
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the direct economic value generated and distributed, providing insights into how wealth is created for stakeholders and the economic profile of the organization.
requirements: Organizations must report direct economic value generated (revenues), economic value distributed (operating costs, employee wages and benefits, payments to providers of capital, payments to government by country, and community investments), and economic value retained (direct economic value generated minus economic value distributed). If data is presented on a cash basis, justification is required. Reporting should be based on audited financial statements or internally-audited management accounts, and significant EVG&D should be reported separately at country, regional, or market levels.

disclosure_title: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the financial implications and other risks and opportunities posed by climate change that could significantly affect their operations, revenue, or expenditures.
requirements: Organizations must describe the risks and opportunities related to climate change, classify them as physical, regulatory, or other, and detail the impact, financial implications, management methods, and costs associated with these risks and opportunities. If the organization lacks systems to calculate these implications, it should report its plans to develop such systems. Additional recommended characteristics include risk/opportunity drivers, projected time frames, direct and indirect impacts, potential impacts on costs and demand, likelihood, and magnitude of impact.

disclosure_title: Defined benefit plan obligations and other retirement plans
description: Disclosure GRI 201-3 requires organizations to report on defined benefit plan obligations and other retirement plans, detailing the estimated value of liabilities, coverage by assets, funding strategies, contribution percentages, and participation levels in retirement plans.
requirements: 1. Estimated value of liabilities if met by general resources. 2. If a separate fund exists: a. Coverage of liabilities by assets; b. Basis and date of estimate; c. If not fully covered, explain strategy and timescale for achieving full coverage. 3. Percentage of salary contributed by employee or employer. 4. Level of participation in retirement plans.

disclosure_title: Financial assistance received from government
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the total monetary value of financial assistance received from any government during the reporting period, including various forms of financial support such as tax relief, subsidies, grants, and other financial benefits.
requirements: Organizations must report the total monetary value of financial assistance received from government, categorized by type (e.g., tax relief, subsidies, grants) and by country. They must also disclose the extent of government presence in the shareholding structure and apply generally accepted accounting principles to determine the monetary value.

disclosure_title: Ratios of standard entry level wage by gender compared to local minimum wage
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the ratios of standard entry level wages by gender compared to local minimum wage at significant locations of operation, as well as actions taken to ensure that other workers are compensated above minimum wage.
requirements: 1. Report the relevant ratio of entry level wage by gender to the minimum wage at significant locations of operation. 2. Describe actions taken to determine if other workers (excluding employees) are paid above minimum wage. 3. Indicate whether a local minimum wage is absent or variable at significant locations of operation, by gender. 4. Define 'significant locations of operation'.

disclosure_title: Proportion of senior management hired from the local community
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the percentage of senior management hired from the local community at significant locations of operation, demonstrating local market presence and engagement.
requirements: 1. Percentage of senior management at significant locations of operation hired from the local community. 2. Definition of 'senior management'. 3. Geographical definition of 'local'. 4. Definition of 'significant locations of operation'. 5. Calculation based on full-time employees.

disclosure_title: Infrastructure investments and services supported
description: Disclosure 203-1 requires organizations to report on the extent of their significant infrastructure investments and the services they support, including the impacts on communities and local economies.
requirements: Organizations must report the size, cost, and duration of each significant infrastructure investment or service supported, the current or expected impacts on communities and local economies (both positive and negative), and whether these investments and services are commercial, in-kind, or pro bono engagements.

disclosure_title: Significant indirect economic impacts
description: Disclosure GRI 203-2 requires organizations to report on significant indirect economic impacts they have on stakeholders and the economy, including both positive and negative impacts.
requirements: Organizations must report examples of significant identified indirect economic impacts, the significance of these impacts in relation to external benchmarks and stakeholder priorities, and how they manage these impacts using Disclosure 3-3 in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021. They should also describe work undertaken to understand these impacts and whether a community needs assessment was conducted.

disclosure_title: Proportion of spending on local suppliers
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the proportion of their procurement budget spent on local suppliers in significant locations of operation, highlighting their support for local economies.
requirements: Organizations must report the percentage of the procurement budget used for significant locations of operation that is spent on local suppliers, including the geographical definition of 'local' and the definition of 'significant locations of operation'. The percentages should be calculated based on invoices or commitments made during the reporting period.

disclosure_title: Operations assessed for risks related to corruption
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the assessment of operations for risks related to corruption, including the total number and percentage of operations assessed and any significant risks identified.
requirements: Total number and percentage of operations assessed for risks related to corruption; Significant risks related to corruption identified through the risk assessment.

disclosure_title: Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the communication and training related to their anti-corruption policies and procedures, including the extent to which these have been communicated to governance body members, employees, and business partners.
requirements: 1. Total number and percentage of governance body members communicated to, broken down by region. 2. Total number and percentage of employees communicated to, broken down by employee category and region. 3. Total number and percentage of business partners communicated to, broken down by type and region. 4. Total number and percentage of governance body members trained on anti-corruption, broken down by region. 5. Total number and percentage of employees trained on anti-corruption, broken down by employee category and region.

disclosure_title: Confirmed incidents of corruption and actions taken
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report confirmed incidents of corruption and the actions taken in response to those incidents.
requirements: 1. Total number and nature of confirmed incidents of corruption. 2. Total number of confirmed incidents in which employees were dismissed or disciplined for corruption. 3. Total number of confirmed incidents when contracts with business partners were terminated or not renewed due to violations related to corruption. 4. Public legal cases regarding corruption brought against the organization or its employees during the reporting period and the outcomes of such cases.

disclosure_title: Legal actions for anti-competitive behavior, anti-trust, and monopoly practices
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on legal actions related to anti-competitive behavior, anti-trust, and monopoly practices in which they are identified as participants.
requirements: Organizations must report the number of legal actions pending or completed during the reporting period regarding anti-competitive behavior and violations of anti-trust and monopoly legislation. Additionally, they must include the main outcomes of completed legal actions, such as any decisions or judgments.

disclosure_title: Approach to tax
description: Disclosure GRI 207-1 requires organizations to report their approach to tax, including their tax strategy, governance structure for tax strategy approval, regulatory compliance approach, and how their tax approach aligns with business and sustainable development strategies.
requirements: 1. Description of the approach to tax, including: a. Existence of a tax strategy and link if publicly available; b. Governance body or executive position responsible for reviewing and approving the tax strategy, including review frequency; c. Approach to regulatory compliance; d. Linkage of tax approach to business and sustainable development strategies. 2. Examples of tax practices, such as use of tax havens or tax incentives, to illustrate risk appetite and acceptable practices.

disclosure_title: Tax governance, control, and risk management
description: Disclosure 207-2 requires organizations to report on their tax governance, control, and risk management framework, detailing how tax compliance is managed and evaluated within the organization.
requirements: 1. Description of the tax governance and control framework, including: a. Governance body or executive accountable for tax strategy compliance. b. How the tax approach is embedded in the organization. c. Approach to tax risks, including identification, management, and monitoring. d. Evaluation of compliance with the tax governance framework. 2. Mechanisms for raising concerns about business conduct related to tax. 3. Assurance process for tax disclosures, including references to external assurance reports if applicable.

disclosure_title: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
description: Disclosure 207-3 requires organizations to report their approach to stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax, including engagement with tax authorities, public policy advocacy on tax, and processes for collecting stakeholder views.
requirements: 1. A description of the approach to engagement with tax authorities. 2. A description of the approach to public policy advocacy on tax. 3. Processes for collecting and considering the views and concerns of stakeholders, including external stakeholders.

disclosure_title: Country-by-country reporting
description: Disclosure GRI 207-4 requires organizations to report financial, economic, and tax-related information for each jurisdiction in which they operate, focusing on tax jurisdictions where entities are resident for tax purposes.

requirements.tax_jurisdictions: All tax jurisdictions where the entities included in the organization’s audited consolidated financial statements are resident for tax purposes.

reporting_information.iii: Number of employees, and the basis of calculation of this number.
reporting_information.v: Revenues from intra-group transactions with other tax jurisdictions.
reporting_information.vii: Tangible assets other than cash and cash equivalents.
reporting_information.viii: Corporate income tax paid on a cash basis.
reporting_information.ix: Corporate income tax accrued on profit/loss.
reporting_information.x: Reasons for the difference between corporate income tax accrued on profit/loss and the tax due if the statutory tax rate is applied to profit/loss before tax.

requirements.time_period: The time period covered by the information reported should align with the most recent audited consolidated financial statements or financial information filed on public record.

disclosure_title: Organizational details
description: Disclosure ID GRI 2-1 requires organizations to provide detailed information about their organizational details, including reporting practices, activities, governance, and policies.
requirements: Organizations must report all disclosures in this Standard, including a list of entities included in sustainability reporting. Reasons for omission are permitted under certain conditions, and organizations must specify any disclosures they cannot comply with, along with explanations.

disclosure_title: Entities included in the organization’s sustainability reporting
description: This disclosure requires organizations to list all entities included in their sustainability reporting, specify differences between this list and their financial reporting, and explain their approach to consolidating information across multiple entities.
requirements: 1. List all entities included in sustainability reporting. 2. If applicable, specify differences between entities in financial reporting and sustainability reporting. 3. Explain the approach used for consolidating information, including adjustments for minority interests, consideration of mergers/acquisitions/disposals, and differences across disclosures and material topics.

disclosure_title: Reporting period, frequency and contact point
description: Disclosure 2-3 requires organizations to specify the reporting period and frequency of their sustainability reporting, the reporting period for financial reporting, the publication date of the report, and the contact point for inquiries about the report.
requirements: 1. Specify the reporting period for sustainability reporting, including start and end dates. 2. Specify the frequency of sustainability reporting (e.g., annual). 3. Specify the reporting period for financial reporting and explain any misalignment with sustainability reporting. 4. Report the publication date of the report or reported information. 5. Specify the contact point for questions about the report.

disclosure_title: Restatements of information
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report any restatements of previously reported information, explaining the reasons for the restatements and their effects.
requirements: Organizations shall report restatements of information from previous reporting periods, including the reasons for the restatements and the effects of the restatements. They should provide criteria for determining significant changes or errors that warrant a restatement. If no restatements occurred, a brief statement confirming this is sufficient.

disclosure_title: External assurance 2. Activities and workers
description: Disclosure 2-5 requires organizations to describe their policy and practice for seeking external assurance of their sustainability reporting, including the involvement of governance bodies and senior executives, and to provide details about the assurance process if applicable.
requirements: Organizations must describe their policy for external assurance, provide links to assurance reports, detail what was assured and the basis for assurance, including standards used and limitations, and describe the relationship with the assurance provider.

disclosure_title: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their activities, value chain, and other business relationships, providing an overview of their sectors, operations, products, services, supply chain, and significant changes compared to the previous reporting period.

requirements.report sectors: Identify the sectors in which the organization is active.

describe value chain.activities: Report the organization's activities, products, services, and markets served.
describe value chain.downstream entities: Identify entities downstream from the organization and their activities.

requirements.report other business relationships: Provide information on other relevant business relationships.
requirements.describe significant changes: Detail significant changes in sectors, value chain, and business relationships compared to the previous reporting period.

disclosure_title: Employees
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their total number of employees, including breakdowns by gender and region, as well as specific categories such as permanent, temporary, non-guaranteed hours, full-time, and part-time employees.
requirements: 1. Report total number of employees with breakdown by gender and region. 2. Report total number of permanent, temporary, non-guaranteed hours, full-time, and part-time employees, each with breakdown by gender and region. 3. Describe methodologies and assumptions used for data compilation, including reporting methods (head count, FTE, etc.) and timing (end of reporting period, average, etc.). 4. Provide contextual information for understanding reported data. 5. Describe significant fluctuations in employee numbers during the reporting period and between periods.

disclosure_title: Workers who are not employees 3. Governance
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the total number of workers who are not employees and whose work is controlled by the organization, along with details about their types, contractual relationships, and the nature of their work.
requirements: Organizations must report the total number of non-employee workers, describe the most common types of workers and their contractual relationships, the type of work performed, the methodologies and assumptions used for data compilation, and any significant fluctuations in the number of non-employee workers during the reporting period.

disclosure_title: Governance structure and composition
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe their governance structure, including the composition and roles of the highest governance body and its committees, particularly in relation to overseeing the management of the organization's impacts on the economy, environment, and people.
requirements: Organizations must describe their governance structure, list the committees responsible for decision-making and oversight, and detail the composition of the highest governance body and its committees by various indicators such as executive and non-executive members, independence, tenure, significant positions, gender, under-represented social groups, relevant competencies, and stakeholder representation.

disclosure_title: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe the nomination and selection processes for the highest governance body and its committees, including the criteria used for nominating and selecting members.
requirements: Organizations must describe the nomination and selection processes, the criteria for nominating and selecting members (including stakeholder views, diversity, independence, and relevant competencies), and provide guidance on independence and competencies.

disclosure_title: Chair of the highest governance body
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on whether the chair of the highest governance body is also a senior executive, and if so, to explain their management function, the reasons for this arrangement, and how conflicts of interest are managed.
requirements: Organizations must report if the chair is a senior executive, explain their function, reasons for the arrangement, and how conflicts of interest are prevented and mitigated.

disclosure_title: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe the role of the highest governance body and senior executives in overseeing the management of the organization's impacts on the economy, environment, and people, including their involvement in developing strategies, engaging with stakeholders, and reviewing the effectiveness of processes.
requirements: 1. Describe the role of the highest governance body and senior executives in developing, approving, and updating the organization’s purpose, value or mission statements, strategies, policies, and goals related to sustainable development. 2. Describe the role of the highest governance body in overseeing due diligence processes to identify and manage impacts, including stakeholder engagement and consideration of outcomes. 3. Describe the role of the highest governance body in reviewing the effectiveness of these processes and report the frequency of this review.

disclosure_title: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe how their highest governance body delegates responsibility for managing impacts on the economy, environment, and people, including the appointment of senior executives and the delegation of responsibilities to other employees.
requirements: Organizations must report on whether they have appointed senior executives responsible for managing impacts, whether they have delegated responsibilities to other employees, and the process and frequency of reporting back to the highest governance body regarding the management of these impacts.

disclosure_title: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the role of their highest governance body in reviewing and approving sustainability reporting, including material topics, and to describe the process involved. If the governance body is not responsible for this, the organization must explain why. Additionally, organizations can report on the establishment of a sustainability reporting committee and the review of internal controls related to sustainability reporting.
requirements: 1. Report whether the highest governance body is responsible for reviewing and approving reported information, including material topics, and describe the review process. 2. If not responsible, explain the reason. 3. Optionally report if a sustainability reporting committee exists to support the review process. 4. Optionally report on the review of internal controls to enhance the integrity of sustainability reporting.

disclosure_title: Conflicts of interest
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe the processes in place to prevent and mitigate conflicts of interest within the highest governance body and to report on the disclosure of such conflicts to stakeholders.
requirements: Organizations must describe processes for preventing and mitigating conflicts of interest, and report whether conflicts of interest are disclosed to stakeholders, including details on cross-board membership, cross-shareholding with suppliers and other stakeholders, existence of controlling shareholders, and related parties along with their relationships, transactions, and outstanding balances.

disclosure_title: Communication of critical concerns
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe how critical concerns are communicated to the highest governance body and to report the total number and nature of these concerns during the reporting period.
requirements: 1. Describe whether and how critical concerns are communicated to the highest governance body. 2. Report the total number and nature of critical concerns communicated during the reporting period. Critical concerns include potential and actual negative impacts on stakeholders raised through grievance mechanisms and other processes.

disclosure_title: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the measures taken to enhance the collective knowledge, skills, and experience of the highest governance body regarding sustainable development.
requirements: Organizations must report the measures taken to advance the collective knowledge, skills, and experience of the highest governance body on sustainable development.

disclosure_title: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe the processes for evaluating the performance of their highest governance body in overseeing management of the organization's impacts on the economy, environment, and people.
requirements: Organizations must report on the evaluation processes, whether evaluations are independent, their frequency, and actions taken in response to evaluations, including any changes to the governance body's composition and organizational practices.

disclosure_title: Remuneration policies
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe their remuneration policies, including commitments to remediate negative impacts, grievance mechanisms, stakeholder involvement, and tracking effectiveness of these mechanisms.
requirements: Organizations must describe their commitments to remediation, approaches to identify and address grievances, processes for remediation, stakeholder involvement in grievance mechanisms, and tracking effectiveness with examples.

disclosure_title: Process to determine remuneration
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe the process for designing remuneration policies and determining remuneration, including oversight by governance bodies, stakeholder engagement, involvement of remuneration consultants, and reporting on stakeholder votes regarding remuneration policies.
requirements: 1. Describe the process for designing remuneration policies and determining remuneration. 2. Indicate whether independent governance body members or a remuneration committee oversee the process. 3. Explain how stakeholder views on remuneration are sought and considered. 4. Disclose if remuneration consultants are involved and their independence. 5. Report results of stakeholder votes on remuneration policies, if applicable.

disclosure_title: Annual total compensation ratio 4. Strategy, policies and practices
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the annual total compensation ratio of the highest-paid individual to the median annual total compensation of all employees, as well as the percentage increase in compensation for both the highest-paid individual and the median employee.
requirements: 1. Report the ratio of the annual total compensation for the highest-paid individual to the median annual total compensation for all employees (excluding the highest-paid individual). 2. Report the ratio of the percentage increase in annual total compensation for the highest-paid individual to the median percentage increase in annual total compensation for all employees (excluding the highest-paid individual). 3. Provide contextual information necessary to understand the data and how it has been compiled.

disclosure_title: Statement on sustainable development strategy
description: This disclosure requires a statement from the highest governance body or most senior executive regarding the relevance of sustainable development to the organization and its strategy for contributing to sustainable development.
requirements: The organization must report on its short, medium, and long-term vision and strategy to manage impacts on the economy, environment, and people; how its purpose and business model aim to prevent negative impacts; short and medium-term strategic priorities aligned with intergovernmental instruments; broader trends affecting the organization; key events and performance against goals; and main challenges, goals, and targets for the next year and the coming three to five years.

disclosure_title: Policy commitments
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe their policy commitments for responsible business conduct, including references to authoritative instruments, stipulations on due diligence, the precautionary principle, and respect for human rights. It also requires detailing specific commitments, stakeholder considerations, and the accessibility of these commitments.
requirements: Organizations must report on the authoritative intergovernmental instruments referenced, stipulations regarding due diligence, the precautionary principle, and respect for human rights. They should describe specific human rights commitments, identify at-risk or vulnerable groups, provide links to the policy commitments if publicly available, and explain any reasons for non-disclosure.

disclosure_title: Embedding policy commitments
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe how they embed their policy commitments for responsible business conduct throughout their activities and business relationships, including allocation of responsibility, integration into strategies and procedures, implementation with business relationships, and training provided.
requirements: Organizations must report on how they allocate responsibility for policy commitments, integrate these commitments into strategies and operational policies, implement them with business relationships, and provide training on these commitments. They should detail the levels of responsibility, oversight mechanisms, alignment with risk management, procurement practices, and communication methods regarding the commitments.

disclosure_title: Processes to remediate negative impacts
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe their commitments and processes for remediating negative impacts they have caused or contributed to, including grievance mechanisms and stakeholder involvement.
requirements: 1. Describe commitments to remediate negative impacts. 2. Describe approach to identify and address grievances, including established grievance mechanisms. 3. Describe other remediation processes beyond grievance mechanisms. 4. Describe stakeholder involvement in the design and operation of grievance mechanisms. 5. Describe tracking of effectiveness of grievance mechanisms and remediation processes, including examples and stakeholder feedback.

disclosure_title: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concerns GRI 2: General Disclosures
description: This disclosure requires organizations to describe the mechanisms available for individuals to seek advice on implementing responsible business conduct policies and to raise concerns about the organization's business conduct.
requirements: Organizations must report on the mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concerns, including their operation, accessibility, confidentiality, and effectiveness. They should provide information on the intended users, the investigation process, non-retaliation measures, user satisfaction, and metrics such as the number of requests for advice and concerns raised during the reporting period.

disclosure_title: Materials used by weight or volume
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the total weight or volume of materials used to produce and package their primary products and services, categorized by non-renewable and renewable materials.
requirements: Organizations must report the total weight or volume of materials used, including raw materials, associated process materials, semi-manufactured goods, and packaging materials. They should specify whether materials were purchased externally or sourced internally, indicate if data are estimated or measured, and describe estimation methods if applicable.

disclosure_title: Recycled input materials used
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the percentage of recycled input materials used in the manufacturing of their primary products and services.
requirements: Organizations must calculate the percentage of recycled input materials using the formula: (Total recycled input materials used / Total input materials used) x 100. They should report the total weight or volume of materials used as specified in Disclosure 301-1 and should include methods used for estimation if applicable.

disclosure_title: Reclaimed products and their packaging materials
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the percentage of reclaimed products and their packaging materials relative to the total products sold within a reporting period.
requirements: Organizations must calculate the percentage of reclaimed products and their packaging materials for each product category using the formula: (Products and their packaging materials reclaimed within the reporting period / Products sold within the reporting period) x 100. Rejects and recalls of products must be excluded from this calculation.

disclosure_title: Energy consumption within the organization
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report their total energy consumption from both renewable and non-renewable sources, including specific metrics for various types of energy consumed and sold, while ensuring no double-counting occurs.
requirements: Total fuel consumption from non-renewable sources, total fuel consumption from renewable sources, total electricity consumption, heating consumption, cooling consumption, steam consumption, total energy consumption in joules or multiples, standards and methodologies used, source of conversion factors, and specific calculations to avoid double-counting.

disclosure_title: Energy consumption outside of the organization
description: Disclosure GRI 302-2 requires organizations to report energy consumption that occurs outside of their operations, specifically in upstream and downstream activities, excluding energy consumption reported in Disclosure 302-1.
requirements: Organizations must report energy consumption in joules or multiples, detail the standards and methodologies used, provide sources for conversion factors, and categorize energy consumption by upstream and downstream activities. They should also describe their approach to selecting different standards and methodologies if applicable.

disclosure_title: Energy intensity
description: Disclosure 302-3 requires organizations to report their energy intensity ratio, which expresses energy consumption in relation to an organization-specific metric, helping to contextualize energy efficiency.
requirements: 1. Report the energy intensity ratio for the organization. 2. Specify the organization-specific metric used as the denominator. 3. Include types of energy in the ratio (fuel, electricity, heating, cooling, steam, or all). 4. Indicate whether the ratio uses energy consumption within the organization, outside of it, or both. 5. Calculate the ratio by dividing absolute energy consumption (numerator) by the organization-specific metric (denominator). 6. If reporting intensity ratios for both internal and external energy consumption, report them separately. 7. Optionally, provide a breakdown of the energy intensity ratio by business unit, country, type of source, and type of activity.

disclosure_title: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report reductions in energy requirements of sold products and services during the reporting period, measured in joules or multiples.
requirements: Organizations must report the reductions in energy requirements, the basis for calculating these reductions (including the chosen base year or baseline), and the standards, methodologies, assumptions, and/or calculation tools used. Additionally, organizations are encouraged to describe their approach to selecting different standards and methodologies and to refer to industry standards where available.

disclosure_title: Interactions with water as a shared resource
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their interactions with water as a shared resource, detailing how water is withdrawn, consumed, and discharged, as well as the water-related impacts caused or contributed to by their operations, products, or services.

requirements.a: A description of how the organization interacts with water, including withdrawal, consumption, discharge, and related impacts.
requirements.b: A description of the approach used to identify water-related impacts, including assessment scope, timeframe, and methodologies.
requirements.c: A description of how water-related impacts are addressed, including stakeholder engagement and collaboration with suppliers or customers.
requirements.d: An explanation of the process for setting water-related goals and targets, and their relation to public policy and local water stress contexts.

recommendations.1: An overview of water use across the organization’s value chain.
recommendations.2: A list of specific catchments where the organization causes significant water-related impacts.

disclosure_title: Management of water discharge-related impacts 2. Topic disclosures
description: Disclosure 303-2 requires organizations to report on the management of water discharge-related impacts, specifically detailing minimum standards for effluent discharge quality and the determination of these standards.
requirements: Organizations must describe any minimum standards set for effluent discharge quality, including how these standards were determined, any internally developed standards, sector-specific standards considered, and whether the profile of the receiving waterbody was taken into account.

disclosure_title: Water withdrawal
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report total water withdrawal from various sources, including surface water, groundwater, seawater, produced water, and third-party water, both overall and specifically from areas experiencing water stress.
requirements: Total water withdrawal in megaliters from all areas and a breakdown by source (surface water, groundwater, seawater, produced water, third-party water). Additionally, report total water withdrawal from areas with water stress, also broken down by source. Provide a breakdown of total water withdrawal by freshwater and other water categories. Include contextual information on data compilation methods and use credible tools for assessing water stress.

disclosure_title: Water discharge
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their water discharge, including total volumes, breakdowns by destination and quality, treatment levels, and compliance with discharge limits for substances of concern.
requirements: Total water discharge in megaliters, breakdown by destination (surface water, groundwater, seawater, third-party water), breakdown by water quality categories (freshwater and other water), total discharge to areas with water stress, priority substances of concern and their treatment, incidents of non-compliance, and contextual information on data compilation.

disclosure_title: Water consumption
description: Disclosure GRI 303-5 requires organizations to report on their total water consumption, particularly focusing on areas with water stress, and to provide contextual information regarding the data compilation methods used.

requirements.total_water_consumption: Total water consumption from all areas in megaliters.
requirements.water_stress_consumption: Total water consumption from all areas with water stress in megaliters.
requirements.change_in_water_storage: Change in water storage in megaliters, if significant water-related impact is identified.
requirements.contextual_information: Any contextual information necessary to understand how the data have been compiled, including standards, methodologies, assumptions, and whether the information is calculated, estimated, modeled, or sourced from direct measurements.

disclosure_title: Operational sites owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to, protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report information about their operational sites that are owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas.
requirements: For each operational site, report the geographic location, subsurface and underground land ownership, position in relation to protected areas, type of operation, size of the operational site, biodiversity value characterized by the ecosystem type, and biodiversity value characterized by protected status listings.

disclosure_title: Significant impacts of activities, products and services on biodiversity
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the significant direct and indirect impacts of their activities, products, and services on biodiversity, including both negative and positive effects.
requirements: Organizations must report the nature of significant impacts on biodiversity, including construction or use of infrastructure, pollution, introduction of invasive species, reduction of species, habitat conversion, and changes in ecological processes. They must also detail the species affected, extent and duration of impacts, and whether the impacts are reversible or irreversible.

disclosure_title: Habitats protected or restored
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the size and location of habitat areas that have been protected or restored, including the success of restoration measures, partnerships for habitat protection, the status of each area, and the standards used.
requirements: 1. Size and location of all habitat areas protected or restored, and whether the success of the restoration measure was approved by independent external professionals. 2. Existence of partnerships with third parties for habitat protection or restoration. 3. Status of each area based on its condition at the close of the reporting period. 4. Standards, methodologies, and assumptions used in the reporting.

disclosure_title: IUCN Red List species and national conservation list species with habitats in areas affected by operations
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the total number of IUCN Red List species and national conservation list species with habitats affected by their operations, categorized by levels of extinction risk.
requirements: Organizations must report the total number of species by level of extinction risk: Critically endangered, Endangered, Vulnerable, Near threatened, and Least concern. They should also compare this information with planning documentation and monitoring records for consistency.

disclosure_title: GHG emissions intensity
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report their greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions intensity, which is the ratio of absolute GHG emissions to an organization-specific metric.
requirements: 1. GHG emissions intensity ratio for the organization. 2. Organization-specific metric (denominator) chosen to calculate the ratio. 3. Types of GHG emissions included in the intensity ratio (Scope 1, Scope 2, and/or Scope 3). 4. Gases included in the calculation (CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs, SF6, NF3). 5. Calculate the ratio by dividing absolute GHG emissions (numerator) by the organization-specific metric (denominator). 6. If reporting Scope 3 emissions, report this intensity ratio separately. 7. Recommendations for breakdown by business unit, country, type of source, and type of activity.

disclosure_title: Reduction of GHG emissions
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the reduction of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions as a result of specific reduction initiatives.
requirements: 1. GHG emissions reduced in metric tons of CO2 equivalent. 2. Gases included in the calculation (e.g., CO, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs, SF6, NF3). 3. Base year or baseline with rationale. 4. Scopes of reductions (Scope 1, Scope 2, Scope 3). 5. Standards, methodologies, assumptions, and/or calculation tools used. Exclude reductions from reduced production capacity or outsourcing. Use inventory or project method for accounting. Calculate total reductions as the sum of primary and significant secondary effects. Report reductions for each Scope type separately and offsets separately.

disclosure_title: Emissions of ozone-depleting substances (ODS)
description: Disclosure GRI 305-6 requires organizations to report on emissions of ozone-depleting substances (ODS), including the production, imports, and exports of ODS in metric tons of CFC-11 equivalent, while excluding recycled and reused ODS.
requirements: Organizations must report the production of ODS calculated as the amount produced minus the amount destroyed by approved technologies and the amount used as feedstock. They should include substances in the calculation, sources of emission factors, and standards or methodologies used. Recommendations include describing the approach to selecting different standards and providing a breakdown of ODS data by business unit, country, type of source, and type of activity.

disclosure_title: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report significant air emissions, including nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other specified pollutants, along with the methodologies and assumptions used in their calculations.
requirements: Organizations must report significant air emissions in kilograms or multiples for NOx, SOx, persistent organic pollutants (POP), volatile organic compounds (VOC), hazardous air pollutants (HAP), particulate matter (PM), and other relevant categories. They must also provide the source of emission factors, standards, methodologies, assumptions, and/or calculation tools used. Organizations can calculate emissions through direct measurement, site-specific data, published emission factors, or estimations, with a requirement to indicate the basis for any estimations.

disclosure_title: Water discharge by quality and destination
description: Disclosure 306-1 requires organizations to report on the total volume of planned and unplanned water discharges, detailing the destination and quality of the water, including treatment methods and whether the water was reused by another organization.
requirements: Organizations must report the total volume of planned and unplanned water discharges by destination, quality (including treatment methods), and whether the water was reused. They should also provide standards, methodologies, and assumptions used in the compilation. If discharging effluents, organizations should report water quality using standard parameters like Biological Oxygen Demand (BOD) or Total Suspended Solids (TSS), consistent with sector-specific practices.

disclosure_title: Waste by type and disposal method
description: Disclosure GRI 306-2 requires organizations to report the total weight of hazardous and non-hazardous waste, categorized by various disposal methods, and to explain how the disposal methods were determined.
requirements: a. Total weight of hazardous waste with breakdown by disposal methods: Reuse, Recycling, Composting, Recovery (including energy recovery), Incineration, Deep well injection, Landfill, On-site storage, Other. b. Total weight of non-hazardous waste with the same breakdown. c. Explanation of how the waste disposal method was determined: disposed of directly by the organization, information from waste disposal contractor, or organizational defaults of the contractor. Compilation requirements include identifying hazardous waste per national legislation, excluding non-hazardous wastewater, and estimating weight if no data is available.

disclosure_title: Significant spills
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on significant spills, including the total number and volume of recorded spills, detailed information for each spill, and the impacts of those spills.
requirements: Organizations must report the total number and total volume of significant spills, provide specific details for each spill (location, volume, material type), and describe the impacts of the spills.

disclosure_title: Transport of hazardous waste
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the transport of hazardous waste, including total weights of hazardous waste transported, imported, exported, and treated, as well as the percentage of hazardous waste shipped internationally and the methodologies used for these calculations.
requirements: Organizations must report total weight for hazardous waste transported, imported, exported, and treated; percentage of hazardous waste shipped internationally; and provide standards, methodologies, and assumptions used for calculations. They must convert volumes to weight and explain the methodology for these conversions.

disclosure_title: Water bodies affected by water discharges and/or runoff
description: Disclosure 306-5 requires organizations to report on water bodies and related habitats significantly affected by water discharges and/or runoff, including details about their size, protection status, and biodiversity value.
requirements: Organizations must report water bodies affected by discharges that meet specific criteria, such as discharges accounting for 5% or more of the water body's annual volume, known significant impacts, sensitivity of the water body, discharges to Ramsar-listed wetlands, high biodiversity value, or importance to local communities.

disclosure_title: Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on significant actual and potential waste-related impacts, detailing the inputs, activities, and outputs that lead to these impacts, and whether they relate to waste generated in the organization's own activities or in its value chain.
requirements: Organizations must describe the inputs, activities, and outputs leading to significant waste-related impacts, including upstream and downstream waste generation. They should report a process flow of these elements and can specify types of inputs and outputs, assess hazardous characteristics, and group them by various criteria such as quantity and type of waste generated.

disclosure_title: Management of significant waste-related impacts 2. Topic disclosures
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report how they manage significant waste-related impacts, including the prevention of waste generation and the management of waste that cannot be prevented, both in their own activities and throughout their value chain.
requirements: Organizations must report how they manage waste using Disclosure 3-3 in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021, and any relevant disclosures from GRI 306-1 and GRI 306-2 that pertain to their waste-related impacts.

disclosure_title: Waste generated
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the total weight of waste generated in metric tons, along with a breakdown of the waste composition, and contextual information to understand the data and its compilation.
requirements: Total weight of waste generated in metric tons, breakdown by composition, exclusion of effluent unless required by legislation, and use of 1000 kilograms as the measure for a metric ton.

disclosure_title: Waste diverted from disposal
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the total weight of waste diverted from disposal, including a breakdown by composition and recovery operations for both hazardous and non-hazardous waste.
requirements: 1. Total weight of waste diverted from disposal in metric tons, with a breakdown by composition. 2. Total weight of hazardous waste diverted from disposal in metric tons, with a breakdown by recovery operations: preparation for reuse, recycling, and other recovery operations. 3. Total weight of non-hazardous waste diverted from disposal in metric tons, with a breakdown by recovery operations: preparation for reuse, recycling, and other recovery operations. 4. Breakdown of total weight of hazardous and non-hazardous waste diverted from disposal by onsite and offsite recovery operations. 5. Contextual information necessary to understand the data and its compilation. 6. Exclude effluent unless required by national legislation. 7. Use 1000 kilograms as the measure for a metric ton.

disclosure_title: Waste directed to disposal
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the total weight of waste directed to disposal, including a breakdown by composition and disposal operations for both hazardous and non-hazardous waste.
requirements: Total weight of waste directed to disposal in metric tons, breakdown by composition; total weight of hazardous waste directed to disposal with breakdown by incineration (with/without energy recovery), landfilling, and other operations; total weight of non-hazardous waste directed to disposal with similar breakdown; onsite and offsite disposal weight for each operation; contextual information on data compilation.

disclosure_title: New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the percentage of new suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria as part of their due diligence processes.
requirements: Percentage of new suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria.

disclosure_title: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the negative environmental impacts in their supply chain and the actions taken to address these impacts.

requirements.a: Number of suppliers assessed for environmental impacts.
requirements.b: Number of suppliers identified as having significant actual and potential negative environmental impacts.
requirements.c: Significant actual and potential negative environmental impacts identified in the supply chain.
requirements.d: Percentage of suppliers identified as having significant actual and potential negative environmental impacts with which improvements were agreed upon as a result of assessment.
requirements.e: Percentage of suppliers identified as having significant actual and potential negative environmental impacts with which relationships were terminated as a result of assessment, and why.

disclosure_title: Process to determine material topics
description: Disclosure GRI 3-1 requires organizations to outline the process used to determine their material topics, which are the most significant impacts on the economy, environment, and people, including human rights.
requirements: Organizations must document their approach to identifying and assessing impacts, test material topics with experts, prioritize significant impacts for reporting, and review changes in material topics compared to the previous reporting period. They must also include a list of material topics in the GRI content index and explain any topics from the Sector Standards that are not considered material.

disclosure_title: List of material topics
description: This disclosure requires the organization to list its material topics and report any changes to this list compared to the previous reporting period.
requirements: The organization must list its material topics, report changes to the list compared to the previous reporting period, include the material topics in the GRI content index, and explain why any topics from the Sector Standards that are not considered material are excluded.

disclosure_title: Management of material topics
description: Disclosure 3-3 requires organizations to describe the impacts of their material topics on the economy, environment, and people, including human rights. It also requires reporting on policies, actions taken to manage these topics, tracking effectiveness, and stakeholder engagement.
requirements: 1. Describe actual and potential impacts (negative and positive) on economy, environment, and people, including human rights. 2. Report involvement with negative impacts and describe related activities or business relationships. 3. Describe policies or commitments regarding the material topic. 4. Describe actions taken to manage the topic and related impacts, including prevention, mitigation, and management of both negative and positive impacts. 5. Report on tracking effectiveness of actions, including processes, goals, targets, indicators, effectiveness, and lessons learned. 6. Describe stakeholder engagement and its influence on actions taken.

disclosure_title: New employee hires and employee turnover
description: Disclosure GRI 401-1 requires organizations to report the total numbers and rates of new employee hires and employee turnover during the reporting period, categorized by age group, gender, and region.
requirements: Organizations must report the total number and rate of new employee hires and employee turnover during the reporting period, by age group, gender, and region. The age groups recommended are: Under 30 years old, 30-50 years old, and Over 50 years old. Organizations are free to choose the methodology for calculating these rates and should describe data measurements and bases for calculations.

disclosure_title: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the benefits provided to full-time employees that are not extended to temporary or part-time employees, highlighting the organization's investment in human resources.
requirements: Organizations must report the benefits standard for full-time employees but not provided to temporary or part-time employees, categorized by significant locations of operation. Minimum benefits to report include life insurance, health care, disability and invalidity coverage, parental leave, retirement provision, stock ownership, and others. In-kind benefits such as sports or child day care facilities and free meals should be excluded from this reporting.

disclosure_title: Parental leave
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on parental leave entitlements and usage, including the number of employees entitled to and taking parental leave, their return to work rates, and retention rates after returning from leave, disaggregated by gender.

requirements.total_employees_entitled: Total number of employees that were entitled to parental leave, by gender.
requirements.total_employees_took_leave: Total number of employees that took parental leave, by gender.
requirements.total_employees_returned: Total number of employees that returned to work in the reporting period after parental leave ended, by gender.
requirements.total_employees_retained: Total number of employees that returned to work after parental leave ended that were still employed 12 months after their return to work, by gender.
requirements.return_to_work_rate: Return to work rate = (Total number of employees that did return to work after parental leave / Total number of employees due to return to work after taking parental leave) x 100
requirements.retention_rate: Retention rate = (Total number of employees retained 12 months after returning to work following a period of parental leave / Total number of employees returning from parental leave in the prior reporting period(s)) x 100

disclosure_title: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
standard: GRI - GRI 402_ Labor and Management Relations 2016
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the minimum number of weeks’ notice typically provided to employees and their representatives prior to significant operational changes that could substantially affect them.
requirements: Organizations must report the minimum notice period for significant operational changes, and for those with collective bargaining agreements, indicate whether the notice period and consultation provisions are specified in those agreements.

disclosure_title: Occupational health and safety management system
standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the implementation of an occupational health and safety management system, including legal requirements and recognized standards, as well as the scope of workers and workplaces covered by the system.
requirements: 1. A statement on whether an occupational health and safety management system has been implemented, including: i. Legal requirements followed in implementation, with a list of those requirements; ii. Recognized risk management and/or management system standards/guidelines followed, with a list of those standards/guidelines. 2. A description of the scope of workers, activities, and workplaces covered by the system, including explanations for any exclusions.

disclosure_title: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
