standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their processes for identifying work-related hazards, assessing risks, and investigating incidents, ensuring the protection of workers who report hazards or remove themselves from unsafe situations.
requirements: Organizations must describe processes for hazard identification and risk assessment, including quality assurance and competency of personnel; processes for workers to report hazards and remove themselves from unsafe situations; and processes for investigating work-related incidents, including corrective actions and improvements to the health and safety management system.

disclosure_title: Occupational health services
standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the functions of occupational health services that help identify and eliminate hazards and minimize risks, as well as how they ensure the quality of these services and facilitate access for workers.
requirements: Organizations must describe the functions of occupational health services, ensure quality through competent personnel and compliance with legal standards, and facilitate access by providing services at the workplace, arranging transport, and offering information in understandable language. Additionally, organizations should maintain confidentiality of personal health information and ensure it is not used for favorable or unfavorable treatment of workers.

disclosure_title: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the processes for worker participation and consultation in the development, implementation, and evaluation of occupational health and safety management systems, as well as communication of relevant information to workers.
requirements: Organizations must describe the processes for worker participation and consultation, including details about joint management-worker health and safety committees, their responsibilities, meeting frequency, decision-making authority, and representation of workers. Additionally, organizations should report on occupational health and safety topics covered in formal agreements with trade unions.

disclosure_title: Worker training on occupational health and safety
standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the occupational health and safety training provided to workers, including both generic and specific training related to work-related hazards and situations.
requirements: Organizations must describe the occupational health and safety training provided, including how training needs are assessed, the design and delivery of training (content, competency of trainers, target audience, frequency, language), whether training is free and during paid hours, attendance requirements, and how training effectiveness is evaluated.

disclosure_title: Promotion of worker health
standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on how they promote worker health by facilitating access to non-occupational medical and healthcare services and offering voluntary health promotion programs to address major non-work-related health risks.
requirements: 1. An explanation of how the organization facilitates workers’ access to non-occupational medical and healthcare services, including the scope of access provided. 2. A description of any voluntary health promotion services and programs offered to workers, including specific health risks addressed and how access to these services is facilitated. 3. Information on how the organization maintains the confidentiality of workers’ personal health-related information. 4. Assurance that personal health-related information and participation in services or programs is not used for favorable or unfavorable treatment of workers.

disclosure_title: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their approach to preventing or mitigating significant negative occupational health and safety impacts that are directly linked to their operations, products, or services through their business relationships.
requirements: Organizations must describe their strategies for preventing or mitigating occupational health and safety impacts, including the related hazards and risks. They should also demonstrate efforts to exercise leverage in situations where they do not have direct control over the work and workplace.

disclosure_title: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the number and percentage of employees and non-employee workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system, including details on internal and external audits.
requirements: 1. Number and percentage of all employees and non-employee workers covered by the occupational health and safety management system. 2. Number and percentage of those covered by a system that has been internally audited. 3. Number and percentage of those covered by a system that has been externally audited or certified. 4. Explanation of any exclusions of workers from this disclosure, including types of excluded workers. 5. Contextual information on how the data were compiled, including standards and methodologies used.

disclosure_title: Work-related injuries
standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on work-related injuries, including rates of high-consequence injuries (excluding fatalities) and recordable injuries, along with additional contextual information about the nature and causes of these injuries.
requirements: 1. Number and rate of fatalities as a result of work-related injury; 2. Number and rate of high-consequence work-related injuries (excluding fatalities); 3. Number and rate of recordable work-related injuries; 4. Main types of work-related injury; 5. Number of hours worked; 6. For non-employee workers, similar reporting as above; 7. Identification of work-related hazards; 8. Actions taken to eliminate hazards; 9. Contextual information for data compilation.

disclosure_title: Work-related ill health
standard: GRI - GRI 403_ Occupational Health and Safety 2018
description: Disclosure GRI 403-10 requires organizations to report on work-related ill health, including fatalities, recordable cases, types of ill health, and hazards that pose risks to health, along with actions taken to mitigate these risks.

for_employees.fatalities: Number of fatalities as a result of work-related ill health
for_employees.recordable_cases: Number of cases of recordable work-related ill health
for_employees.main_types: Main types of work-related ill health

for_non_employees.fatalities: Number of fatalities as a result of work-related ill health
for_non_employees.recordable_cases: Number of cases of recordable work-related ill health
for_non_employees.main_types: Main types of work-related ill health

hazards.determination: How work-related hazards have been determined
hazards.causes: Which hazards have caused or contributed to cases of ill health during the reporting period
hazards.actions: Actions taken or underway to eliminate these hazards and minimize risks

requirements.exclusions: Whether any workers have been excluded from this disclosure and the types of worker excluded
requirements.contextual_information: Any contextual information necessary to understand how the data have been compiled
requirements.fatalities_in_recordable_cases: Include fatalities in the calculation of recordable work-related ill health

disclosure_title: Average hours of training per year per employee
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the average hours of training undertaken by employees during the reporting period, categorized by gender and employee category.
requirements: Organizations must report the average training hours per employee, average training hours per female employee, average training hours per male employee, and average training hours per employee category. Employee numbers should be expressed as either head count or full-time equivalent (FTE) and reported consistently.

disclosure_title: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on programs implemented to upgrade employee skills and provide transition assistance for employees facing retirement or termination.
requirements: Organizations must report the type and scope of programs for upgrading employee skills, including internal training courses, funding for external training, sabbatical periods, pre-retirement planning, retraining, severance pay, job placement services, and assistance for transitioning to non-working life.

disclosure_title: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the percentage of total employees, categorized by gender and employee category, who received regular performance and career development reviews during the reporting period.
requirements: Percentage of total employees by gender and by employee category who received a regular performance and career development review during the reporting period. Organizations should use data from Disclosure 2-7 in GRI 2 to identify the total number of employees and draw from Disclosure 405-1 in GRI 405 to identify the total number of employees by employee category.

disclosure_title: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
standard: GRI - GRI 405_ Diversity and Equal Opportunity 2016
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the diversity of their governance bodies and employees, focusing on gender, age groups, and other relevant diversity indicators.
requirements: Organizations must report the percentage of individuals within governance bodies and employees in the following diversity categories: i. Gender; ii. Age group: under 30 years old, 30-50 years old, over 50 years old; iii. Other indicators of diversity where relevant (such as minority or vulnerable groups). Additionally, organizations should use data from Disclosure 2-7 in GRI 2: General Disclosures 2021 to identify the total number of employees.

disclosure_title: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
standard: GRI - GRI 405_ Diversity and Equal Opportunity 2016
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men for each employee category in significant locations of operation.
requirements: The reporting organization must provide the ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men for each employee category, specifying the definition of 'significant locations of operation'. It is recommended to base remuneration on the average pay of each gender grouping within each employee category.

disclosure_title: Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report incidents of discrimination that occurred during the reporting period, including the status of these incidents and the corrective actions taken.
requirements: Total number of incidents of discrimination during the reporting period; status of the incidents and actions taken, including whether the incident was reviewed, if remediation plans are being implemented, if remediation plans have been implemented with results reviewed, and if the incident is no longer subject to action. Incidents must include those based on race, color, sex, religion, political opinion, national extraction, or social origin, as well as other relevant forms of discrimination.

disclosure_title: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
standard: GRI - GRI 407_ Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining 2016
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on operations and suppliers where the rights to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk, including the type of operations, geographic areas, and measures taken to support these rights.
requirements: Organizations must report on operations and suppliers at risk of violating workers' rights to freedom of association and collective bargaining, detailing the type of operation and geographic areas. They must also describe measures taken during the reporting period to support these rights.

disclosure_title: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on operations and suppliers that are considered to have significant risks for incidents of child labor and young workers exposed to hazardous work.
requirements: Organizations must identify operations and suppliers at significant risk based on type of operation and geographic areas. They must also report on measures taken during the reporting period to contribute to the effective abolition of child labor.

disclosure_title: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
standard: GRI - GRI 409_ Forced or Compulsory Labor 2016
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on operations and suppliers that are considered to have significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor, including the types of operations and geographic areas at risk, as well as measures taken to eliminate such labor.
requirements: 1. Identify operations and suppliers at significant risk for forced or compulsory labor based on type of operation and geographic areas. 2. Report measures taken during the reporting period to eliminate all forms of forced or compulsory labor.

disclosure_title: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the percentage of security personnel who have received formal training in the organization's human rights policies or procedures, including whether these requirements apply to third-party security personnel.
requirements: 1. Percentage of security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures. 2. Clarification on whether training requirements apply to third-party organizations. 3. Calculation should include total security personnel from both the organization and third-party organizations, with a statement on whether third-party employees are included in the calculation.

disclosure_title: Incidents of violations involving rights of indigenous peoples
standard: GRI - GRI 411_ Rights of Indigenous Peoples 2016
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report incidents of violations involving the rights of indigenous peoples, including the status of these incidents and actions taken.
requirements: Total number of identified incidents of violations involving the rights of indigenous peoples during the reporting period, including the status of incidents (reviewed, remediation plans implemented, results reviewed, or no longer subject to action).

disclosure_title: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on their operations that engage with local communities, including the implementation of impact assessments and development programs. It emphasizes the importance of understanding and managing the impacts on local communities through various engagement and assessment processes.
requirements: Organizations must report the percentage of operations with implemented local community engagement, impact assessments, and/or development programs. This includes the use of social impact assessments, environmental impact assessments, public disclosure of assessment results, local community development programs, stakeholder engagement plans, consultation processes including vulnerable groups, worker representation bodies, and formal grievance processes.

disclosure_title: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on operations that have significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities, detailing the location of these operations and the nature of the impacts.
requirements: Organizations must report the location of operations, significant actual and potential negative impacts, vulnerability and risk factors to local communities, exposure to operations, and the intensity, duration, reversibility, and scale of impacts.

disclosure_title: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the percentage of new suppliers that were screened using social criteria, informing stakeholders about the due diligence processes for social impacts in the supply chain.
requirements: Percentage of new suppliers that were screened using social criteria.

disclosure_title: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on negative social impacts in their supply chain and the actions taken to address these impacts.

requirements.a: Number of suppliers assessed for social impacts.
requirements.b: Number of suppliers identified as having significant actual and potential negative social impacts.
requirements.c: Significant actual and potential negative social impacts identified in the supply chain.
requirements.d: Percentage of suppliers identified as having significant actual and potential negative social impacts with which improvements were agreed upon as a result of assessment.
requirements.e: Percentage of suppliers identified as having significant actual and potential negative social impacts with which relationships were terminated as a result of assessment, and why.

disclosure_title: Political contributions
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the total monetary value of financial and in-kind political contributions made directly and indirectly by the organization, categorized by country and recipient/beneficiary.
requirements: 1. Total monetary value of financial and in-kind political contributions made directly and indirectly by the organization by country and recipient/beneficiary. 2. If applicable, how the monetary value of in-kind contributions was estimated. 3. Financial political contributions must be calculated in compliance with national accounting rules, where these exist.

disclosure_title: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
standard: GRI - GRI 416_ Customer Health and Safety 2016
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report the percentage of significant product and service categories for which health and safety impacts are assessed for improvement.
requirements: Percentage of significant product and service categories for which health and safety impacts are assessed for improvement. Organizations can also describe the criteria used for the assessment.

disclosure_title: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
standard: GRI - GRI 416_ Customer Health and Safety 2016
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report incidents of non-compliance with regulations and voluntary codes concerning the health and safety impacts of their products and services during the reporting period.
requirements: Total number of incidents of non-compliance categorized by: incidents resulting in a fine or penalty, incidents resulting in a warning, and incidents related to voluntary codes. If no incidents are identified, a brief statement is sufficient. Exclude incidents where the organization was not at fault and those related to labeling (reported in GRI 417-2). Identify any incidents related to prior periods if applicable.

disclosure_title: Requirements for product and service information and labeling
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on the procedures for product and service information and labeling, ensuring customers have access to information regarding the sourcing, content, safe use, and disposal of products and services.
requirements: Organizations must report whether their procedures require information on: i. Sourcing of components, ii. Content related to environmental or social impacts, iii. Safe use of the product or service, iv. Disposal and its impacts, v. Other relevant information. Additionally, they must provide the percentage of significant product or service categories assessed for compliance with these procedures.

disclosure_title: Incidents of non-compliance concerning product and service information and labeling
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report incidents of non-compliance with regulations and voluntary codes concerning product and service information and labeling.
requirements: Total number of incidents of non-compliance categorized by: incidents resulting in a fine or penalty, incidents resulting in a warning, and incidents of non-compliance with voluntary codes. If no incidents are identified, a brief statement is sufficient. Exclude incidents where the organization was not at fault and identify any incidents related to prior periods if applicable.

disclosure_title: Incidents of non-compliance concerning marketing communications
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report incidents of non-compliance with regulations and voluntary codes concerning marketing communications, including advertising, promotion, and sponsorship.
requirements: Total number of incidents of non-compliance with regulations and/or voluntary codes concerning marketing communications, categorized by: incidents resulting in a fine or penalty, incidents resulting in a warning, and incidents of non-compliance with voluntary codes. If no incidents are identified, a brief statement is sufficient. Exclude incidents where the organization was not at fault and identify any incidents related to prior periods if applicable.

disclosure_title: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
description: This disclosure requires organizations to report on substantiated complaints regarding breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data, including the total number of such complaints and incidents.
requirements: 1. Total number of substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy, categorized by: i. complaints received from outside parties and substantiated by the organization; ii. complaints from regulatory bodies. 2. Total number of identified leaks, thefts, or losses of customer data. 3. If no substantiated complaints are identified, a brief statement of this fact is sufficient. 4. Indication if a substantial number of breaches relate to events in preceding years.

disclosure_title: Government Monitoring and Censorship of Core Products or Services
description: List of countries where core products or services are subject to government-required monitoring, blocking, content filtering, or censoring.
requirements: Discussion and Analysis

disclosure_title: Data Security
description: Number of data breaches, percentage that are personal data breaches, number of users affected.
requirements: Quantitative metrics including number of data breaches, percentage of personal data breaches, and number of users affected.

disclosure_title: Employee Engagement
description: Percentage of employee engagement as a measure of workforce satisfaction and involvement.
requirements: Quantitative percentage (%) of employee engagement.

disclosure_title: Total Water Withdrawn and Consumed in Water-Stressed Regions
description: Total water withdrawn, total water consumed, and percentage of each in regions with High or Extremely High Baseline Water Stress.
requirements: Total water withdrawn (in thousand cubic metres), total water consumed (in thousand cubic metres), and percentage of each in regions with High or Extremely High Baseline Water Stress.

disclosure_title: Diversity Representation in Workforce
description: Percentage of (1) gender and (2) diversity group representation for (a) executive management, (b) non-executive management, (c) technical employees, and (d) all other employees.
requirements: Quantitative Percentage (%)

disclosure_title: Integration of Environmental Considerations into Strategic Planning for Data Centre Needs
description: Discussion of the integration of environmental considerations into strategic planning for data centre needs.
requirements: No specific metrics; qualitative discussion required.

disclosure_title: Environmental Footprint of Hardware Infrastructure
description: Total energy consumed, percentage grid electricity, and percentage renewable.
requirements: Total energy consumed in Gigajoules (GJ), percentage of grid electricity, and percentage of renewable energy.

disclosure_title: Data Privacy & Freedom of Expression Disclosure
description: Description of policies and practices relating to targeted advertising and user privacy.
requirements: The disclosure should include a description of policies and practices related to targeted advertising and user privacy.

disclosure_title: Government-Required Monitoring and Censorship
description: List of countries where core products or services are subject to government-required monitoring, blocking, content filtering, or censoring.
requirements: The disclosure shall include a description of the extent of the effect in each case and, where relevant, a discussion of the entity’s policies and practices related to freedom of expression.

disclosure_title: Total Monetary Losses from User Privacy Legal Proceedings
description: The entity shall briefly describe the nature, context and any corrective actions taken because of monetary losses associated with legal proceedings related to user privacy.
requirements: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with user privacy, presented in currency.

disclosure_title: Data Security Disclosure
description: Description of approach to identifying and addressing data security risks, including use of third-party cybersecurity standards.
requirements: Quantitative metrics include (1) Number of data breaches, (2) percentage that are personal data breaches, (3) number of users affected.

disclosure_title: Percentage of Employees Requiring Work Visa
description: Percentage of employees that require a work visa, including a description of any potential risks of recruiting employees that require a work visa and how the entity manages these risks.
requirements: Quantitative Percentage (%)

disclosure_title: Managing Systemic Risks from Technology Disruptions
description: Number of (1) performance issues and (2) service disruptions; (3) total customer downtime
requirements: Quantitative metrics including Number and Days

disclosure_title: Business Continuity Risks Related to Disruptions of Operations
description: Description of business continuity risks related to disruptions of operations.
requirements: Discussion and Analysis

disclosure_title: Number of users whose information is used for secondary purposes
description: The entity must disclose the number of users whose information is utilized for secondary purposes.
requirements: Quantitative metric reported as a number.

disclosure_title: Monetary Losses from Anti-Competitive Behaviour
description: Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with anti-competitive behaviour regulations.
requirements: Quantitative presentation currency.
